description: The initiative focuses on the Agrupar program in Quito, Ecuador, which aims to enhance food security and promote entrepreneurship through urban vegetable gardens. Established in 2003, it operates as a non-profit entity, leveraging both public and private funds. The program provides training, technical assistance, and market access for participants, primarily targeting vulnerable populations, including older adults and the unemployed. With over 1,200 gardens and 5,200 beneficiaries, it has significantly contributed to reducing malnutrition rates in the community.
name: Conquito
